page.title: 16Lake Formation,Wickhambreaux
page.content: A few years ago there were meadows in the{Great}and{Little Stour Valleys; now there are extensive lakes. {*** Seaton Lakes ***} The lakes at{Seaton}have been formed by the extraction of gravel from the marsh. Excavation started in 1972 and is expected to be completed in about seven years time. They extract about 350 tons of gravel per day. The water in the lakes is about three metres deep. There are three excavators working on the marsh and the gravel is carried by a long conveyor belt (at present about 1000m long and soon to be 1800m long) to the processing plant at{Ickham. {*** Stodmarsh Lakes *** These formed as a result of mining subsidence. The area of water increased considerably after Chislet coal mine was closed in 1968/69.
